steps.title: Pour the evaporated milk into ice cube trays.
steps.content: Pour the evaporated milk into ice cube trays.

steps.title: Place in the freezer for half an hour.
steps.content: Place in the freezer for half an hour. The cubes are ready when ice has formed around the edges of the milk. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Chill the bowl and mixer beaters in the fridge while the cubes are in the freezer.
steps.content: Chill the bowl and mixer beaters in the fridge while the cubes are in the freezer.

steps.title: Remove the chilled bowl and mixer beaters.
steps.content: Remove the chilled bowl and mixer beaters.

steps.title: Take the ice tray out of the freezer and pour the slightly frozen evaporated milk into a pre-chilled bowl.
steps.content: Take the ice tray out of the freezer and pour the slightly frozen evaporated milk into a pre-chilled bowl.

steps.title: Whisk the ice cubes with the chilled beater until a thick texture forms that resembles cream.
steps.content: Whisk the ice cubes with the chilled beater until a thick texture forms that resembles cream. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Use in place of cream for dessert, cake filling etc.
steps.content: Use in place of cream for dessert, cake filling etc. Use a spatula to remove from the bowl.
